post.title: teaching into the network
post.body:
by that i mean not person to person or one on one teaching like sitting in a classroom. 
by that i mean one writes or speaks into the darkness of the online network, without knowing who is outthere or maybe there will never be anybody there. it feels more like you speak to yourself. 
when one speaks to himself, he is probably more honest, less pretending, more searching and more likely reaches soul. 
it is a good thing, it might also be a harmful thing. this form of self-revealing thinking process has its strange power to grab, to poke, to wring, and for the weak and unawared to strangle.  
zero is a good thing. because now it makes this process perpetual. generations of the family will be able to continue this thinking process, maybe well go through years of one thousand.

post.title: when teaching becomes interesting
post.body:
teaching becomes interesting when:

- it is enlightening even to teacher yourself
- it is personal, meaning what you say reaches to your own personal life
- it connects you and your student and create a common ground

post.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
post.body:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Cp4hRjbEq3GmTt74ooSTDNia2uvsKCUU

requirement of reading -

- study all the words that you do not know; use dictionary to find out the meaning;
- what is the relation between paragraphs, how it moves from one paragraph to the next paragraph, what is the method used to control the movement from paragraph to paragraph?
- what is the theme of every segment? how it moves from theme to theme? what determines this theme flow?
- how together these themes make a point? or several points?
- how these points help to make and support one idea? or several ideas?
- what are the ideas about and related to man?

if you are interested in teaching, teaching anything, i would be happy to know more about your thoughts and how we could work towards a platform of teaching. 

drop me a note.

post.title: for your child's future development, talk to doctorZ
post.body: this is an Ad, more more than anything, it is an honest call of duty that is based on many years of my teaching and observation of more than 500 students that i have taught. to most parents i honestly say, you need some help.

post.title: are there talented students
post.body:
generally very few. but of course everyone has his own inherent talent that typically has long destroyed by traditional education, this is particularly true for students from certain geographic regions. it is not necessarily a bad thing, depending on how you see it.

how to discover and develop your innate talent? talk to doctorZ, he is here to help.

post.title: how are my past stuents
post.body:
many of my past students get into harvard, mit, yale, stanford, and many other schools. are they truly and particularly talented? if i honestly judge none of them are what we say truly talented, far away from what we say genius. 

but that does not matter. fact is, many get into these few dream schools. 

what is the secret? get a strategy ready, then work on it.

post.title: towards a grand strategy of college application
post.body:
more than anything, you need a solid strategy if you are serious of getting into schools like harvard or mit. start plan early, work on it early. it is not that hard to get in, it is wholy a matter of prepardness. 

work out a strategy, plan early, act early.

if you do not know how to design a strategy, then ask. i am here to help.

post.body:
taht is an ambitious goal. and that is also an honor we should save for our zeroman that we all know who he is and where he is and for the time being we should let him work on more timely and important things. 

so a smaller, much smaller version of it is on the way of cooking, it is an experiement, it is called 34. here let's go take a quick look.

post.title: there is a game called glass bead game
post.body:
if you haven't done so i urge you to do it, read the book, the glass bead game. it is about a man, his talent, his development, his institution, his destiny, his fate. and surrounding all his life is this game. 

it is not a surprise to me to find 0-34 interesting. it is a game, a complementary game to the glass bead game.

post.title: why this game is so important for our future
post.body:
man has many faces. man works for many agencies. man to make a living, both physically and mentally he habituates himself for new challenges, and risks, and risky things, and eventually for some, questionable endeavors. 

zero and 34 will become norm of our life soon. 

so man will have to face multiple personalities masked before one man. and that man may well be dangerous. 

so it is a critical skill, the skill of cognition. some call it ai. but for us, it is a matter of survival.

let's play this game, early, now.

post.title: a game, again
post.body:
here on zero, there are currently about 5000 users. actively, there are about 400 only. 

so who are they? one by one.

that is a game.

post.title: what constitutes style
post.body:
sure we are talking about writing, the writing style. but you got to agree all styles share some commonality called style. 

what constitutes writing style?

- diction, including spelling;
- grammar
- sentence style, yes this is a big one
- holistic style 
- sense 
- sense of logic 
- control of logic
- embedded emotions
- implied personalities
- implied knowledge structure
- implied personal views
- implied personal life and particular situations

post.title: what is easy and what is difficult
post.body:
a proposition - writing style is difficult to change.

if that is true, then recognizing a person on 0-34 would be a matter of recognizing style. that is a great way to learn english, the ultimate control of a language: the style. 

and i would use this as a solid reason to let my students using 0-34 to learn english. 

cheers. one zero point gained.

post.title: but you say that is too cruel...what if you really want to know who i am
post.body: guys, what would be a good solution for this one?

post.title: so here is the rule of do not ask
and so, here is one way to play the game of teaching....who i am
post.body: so i have quite a few students. i can let them know i am on zero and 34. and their work will be evaluated on zero34. i will hild my identity here. i will not let them know who i am, but sure tehy can guess if they care. i think it is easy enough to hide one's quality. so it would be interesting to communicate with them this way, a way different enough from real campus life.....yes, the 34 life. that is an allure for sure, at least to me.

post.title: think again - why zero is good and where it will exert greatest power
post.body:
part of the power of zero and 34 comes from a promise, accurate or not, it protects your privacy. so you can talk freely about what you think about everything, money, politics, woman or man, sex, making of love.

that creates a truer second life. that is what we can leverage to put more men and women on zero. 

myth has long been proven its value throughout history. so it is important to keep zero its promise.

post.title: zero and 34 as a creativity farm
the ultimate advantage of zero university
post.body:
guys, we all may have various conjectures and answers. they will all make some sense depending on time, situation, and perspective. my pick is its absolute equalness, not necessarily in each's influence at a particular time, but in our equal ability to voice. each voice will not be sanctioned and can not be quelled, its existence is absolute, it lives forever, and at point down the time, it will be heard alout. 

so, say it, write it, let your voice be recorded down right here. it will exert its power.

post.title: how to create a site?
post.body:
Creating a ZeroNet site

Open up your file explorer and navigate to ZeroNet's data directory.
Once there create a new folder named after the address you got from vanitygen.
To keep it simple we are just gonna copy another site for now. So go into the folder of another site and copy everything.
Then go into the folder of your website and paste all the files in.
Open content.json with a text editor and check that no domain it set.
If it is, delete it.

Shut down ZeroNet if you have it running and run the following command in the main directory of ZeroNet:
Linux
python zeronet.py siteSign yourAddress

Windows
Inside the ZeroNet folder execute this command:
..\Python\python.exe zeronet.py siteSign yourAddress

.
On both Operating Systems you will be prompted to enter your Privatekey.
By entering the Privatekey you "prove" that you are the owner of the Site by signing it.
If somebody else gets your Privatekey they can then modify you page, so keep it secret.

Admiring what you did

Start ZeroNet back up, open your Webbrowser and go to 127.0.0.1:43110/YourSitesAddress. 

If you cloned the ZeroBlog site you can now simply modify your Site using the Webinterface after dragging the 0 in the Top right to the left, scrolling down and switching the "This is my Site" switch. After modifying your site you can publish it by pressing the "Sign & Publish" button in the lower right.
You will be asked for the Privatekey again.

If you didn't clone the ZeroBlog site you have to manually sign it as explained in Creating a ZeroNet site.

If you notice any mistakes or have any problems, feel free to comment.

post.title: English writing - the hardest part of learning it as a language
My English teaching curriculum overview
post.body:
- Triangle of Egnlish study: exam, reading, and writing
- target exam - this is the key and one important goal; example exam: SAT, TOEFL
- classical western literature
- essays
- western philosophy
- western history
- world history
- modern western society
- other key knowledge points - science, art, technologies
- English writing
- important themes in English study 
	love, just, history, good and evil, truth, be and being, lust, cheating .......
